thread.title: Liverpool FC collapse due to lack of winter break - Klopp | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Liverpool FC collapse due to lack of winter break - Klopp | Daily Mail Online

author: Reuters Reporter
title: Liverpool FC collapse due to lack of winter break - Klopp | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'December-January,' Klopp said when asked what was the biggest lesson he learned during Liverpool's poor run. 'In December we missed players and did not have the best schedule. You could see the difference physically.' Liverpool's title bid has collapsed in recent weeks as they have dropped to fifth, 11 points behind leaders Chelsea after 25 games. The German manager saw his side collapse from a title bid to fifth in the Premier League 'It was a few things. On a few things we had an influence and on others we did not have an influence - we conceded goals, offside against us, penalty against us,' Klopp rued. 'We could have had two, three or four points more. We are not used to being a top team, maybe we have to be. We are not clever like Chelsea who will be 2-0 up and just finish a game.' Liverpool, who are on a five-day training camp in Spain, travel to 17th-placed Leicester City in the Premier League on February 27. Klopp believes his team could have taken two, three or four more points from their games RELATED ARTICLES
